data.text: @I_mitochondria @stephanieseneff Questions unanswered #QunA #QandA @QandA @normanswan

@maxleaker Keep using me!
Any support is welcome see: https://t.co/G1vmLZfmCU 💎
@maxleaker Saluti, you can read it here: Risk of exposure to babies being fed by mothers vaccinated with… https://t.co/d1s5iRnlLm Share this if you think it's interesting. 🤖
@I_mitochondria Unroll @threadreaderapp brilliant info collection, Thank you so much!
@VikiLovesFACS @drdpogson @I_mitochondria Thank you very, very much for your answers, your time, efforts and dedication.

@drdpogson @MrsTistmuetend @I_mitochondria Have done! I really meant to last week but you wouldn't believe how busy I've been!

https://t.co/tDLOU1EXwy
@VikiLovesFACS @MrsTistmuetend @I_mitochondria That’s a bad nappy.
@VikiLovesFACS @MrsTistmuetend @I_mitochondria please make a thread Viki.

@drdpogson @MrsTistmuetend @I_mitochondria Yes! And I suspect that to work it would actually have to be given all in one go, which... well assuming a 3kg baby, that's 14 times its own bodyweight in milk!

@MrsTistmuetend @drdpogson @I_mitochondria In short, I'm not entirely clear that this is relevant. But if it is, we can say that the amount of milk the baby would need to drink to be equivalent to these mice is way more than they ever would. And that's assuming that your milk is full of vaccine mRNA. Which it isn't. 9/9

@MrsTistmuetend @drdpogson @I_mitochondria And that's assuming that this dosing strategy works if you spread it out over a week, rather than doing all in one go (as they did in the experiments described). 8/

@MrsTistmuetend @drdpogson @I_mitochondria I've had babies, and I know it sometimes *feels* like they drink 42 litres of milk a week. But taking the daily average of 1.4 litres, it's nowhere near that. 7/
@VikiLovesFACS @MrsTistmuetend @I_mitochondria Burp. That’s a lot of milk…

@MrsTistmuetend @drdpogson @I_mitochondria 42 litres of milk.

In that (again being generous) week after vaccination when in some people they could detect some mRNA in the milk. 6/

@MrsTistmuetend @drdpogson @I_mitochondria We've already discussed that vaccine mRNA, if it's present in milk, is at really low levels. But let's be generous and assume that *every single exosome* in your milk is carrying vaccine mRNA. 4/

@MrsTistmuetend @drdpogson @I_mitochondria They tell us how many exosomes we need to give a mouse orally to see a signal in any of the various organs. It's 1,000,000,000,000 for every g of bodyweight. And you can get 70,000,000,000 out of every mL of cow's milk. 3/

@MrsTistmuetend @drdpogson @I_mitochondria And for RNA, it actually seems to come to the conclusion: "no" (in the last paragraph of the results section).

However, if we do our best to get something sensible out of this, and assume that you are roughly speaking a cow, and your baby is roughly speaking a mouse... 2/

@MrsTistmuetend @drdpogson @I_mitochondria I've taken a look at the paper quoted on that point, and it's not clear to me that it's relevant since the question it seems to set out to answer is: Can we use cow's milk exosomes as a way of delivering drugs orally? 1/

@VikiLovesFACS @drdpogson @I_mitochondria Thank you so much, Viki! ❤️
My baby is feeding a lot and so I was afraid what Ms. Cooper says might be correct - also with regard to vaccine mRNA’s survival of the digestive tract and accumulation in the babies‘ brains. Do you maybe also have any reassuring info on this part?
@VikiLovesFACS @MrsTistmuetend @I_mitochondria Viki you really are a treasure. Thankyou!
@MrsTistmuetend @drdpogson @I_mitochondria I hope that sets everything that is claimed in this blog post in a bit of context for you. In short, it has not been very well fact-checked. 16/16

@MrsTistmuetend @drdpogson @I_mitochondria Actually, they were. You can read the reports of these studies in the data packets submitted to the regulatory bodies and no concerning signals were detected (and linked under q2 of this document). 15/

https://t.co/Aw0S36nD2a
@MrsTistmuetend @drdpogson @I_mitochondria Claim 2. "Animal studies were not done in pregnant and lactating animals before we rolled the vaccines out to people." 14/

@MrsTistmuetend @drdpogson @I_mitochondria Furthermore, people who have tried to confirm this report have been unable to. So we don't even know for sure if this was a genuine report. 13/

https://t.co/roQN9kXZAd

@MrsTistmuetend @drdpogson @I_mitochondria Remember that VAERS collects reports of events that have happened after vaccination, but until these events are investigated we can't say if they're caused by vaccination. 12/
@MrsTistmuetend @drdpogson @I_mitochondria If antibodies in breast milk were causing a serious problem for babies, we would see lots of babies having this kind of problem, not just one. 11/

@MrsTistmuetend @drdpogson @I_mitochondria We have lots of data showing antibodies crossing into breast milk (linked in Q7 of this document). It happens in every person we've looked at (as expected - we've evolved for antibodies to get into breast milk because they protect babies!). 10/

https://t.co/Aw0S36nD2a
@MrsTistmuetend @drdpogson @I_mitochondria Claim 1. "Antibodies crossing into breast milk could explain a case of thrombocytopenia in VAERS". 9/

@MrsTistmuetend @drdpogson @I_mitochondria I hope that sets the preprint in context for you.

I will also quickly take on a couple of other claims made in that blog post... 8/
@MrsTistmuetend @drdpogson @I_mitochondria You wouldn't expect that 5 mL syringe of "Calpol" to do much, would you? 7/

@MrsTistmuetend @drdpogson @I_mitochondria It would be equivalent to taking a 5 mL syringe of Calpol, squirting it into an Olympic (50m) swimming pool, giving it a couple of days to mix around then coming back and taking a 5 mL syringe of the mixture out. 6/

@MrsTistmuetend @drdpogson @I_mitochondria 2ng/mL is 2 parts in 1000, 000, 000. This is such a small amount that it could definitely be contamination in the context of a sensitive assay like PCR. 

But let's be cautious and assume it's a genuine signal. What would that mean? 5/

@MrsTistmuetend @drdpogson @I_mitochondria Now let's take a look at that newer study, that detected a maximum of 2ng/mL mRNA in some samples. You can read it here... 4/

https://t.co/IrT7uvTn7p

@MrsTistmuetend @drdpogson @I_mitochondria First, let's look at the question of whether vaccine mRNA gets into breast milk. We already have two studies that were unable to detect any mRNA in breast milk and (as the blog post asks) one of them looked at fatty milk and watery milk separately. 2/
@MrsTistmuetend @drdpogson @I_mitochondria Sorry I'm slow to the party! But let's take a look at the main points that this blog post raises... 1/
@drdpogson @I_mitochondria @VikiLovesFACS I‘m wondering as well. (This thread with all these studies makes me a now worried mother of an eight weeks old baby.)
@I_mitochondria @VikiLovesFACS
@I_mitochondria @stephanieseneff Seen this at "8.3.5 Exposure During Pregnacy or Breastfeeding, and Occupational Exposure" from Pfizer report? https://t.co/YCw00sb4yx https://t.co/gTTLKHdd3O
@I_mitochondria @StephaniePalosP Oh FFS. They are born immune.
@I_mitochondria Thank you for a great thread! It baffles me how “the novel field of covid science” is discovering that it’s not that unique and neither it is isolated from the rest of the knowledge.
@I_mitochondria I wonder if @VikiLovesFACS has further information to clarify?

@I_mitochondria This "vaccine" rollout to people not in the vulnerable group is complete madness! I fear it's a gigantic public health disaster in the making
@I_mitochondria https://t.co/onTCtdybj2
@I_mitochondria @stezia7 Yep . VAERS 4 and a half month old  breast fed baby dead  within 24 hrs of her mother being vaccinated.

@I_mitochondria Also did not include previously infected people

Exactly why i won't be taking them

@I_mitochondria These are my thoughts exactly. If translation is occurring, that means the mrna has not degraded. I don't see how it can degrade before the 3 month mark when the antibodies are said to decline? If the antibodies decline at this time point, is this when mrna finally degrades?
@I_mitochondria You mean "animal" trials, right?
@I_mitochondria The people recommending and giving this should be imprisoned.
@I_mitochondria How do they know this ? They don't.

Finally, the human trials have not even reached a full year yet, did not include pregnant or lactating women, nor nursing infants. 

As a result, no safety can be ascertained, and therefore should not be claimed.

This is exactly why “whole of life” animal studies, including pregnancy and lactation animal studies must be completed BEFORE implementing human trials of any sorts, as per according to point 3 of the Nuremberg code. This was not done. 

https://t.co/82Pfym1xFC

....Conclusions
We are supposed to always err on the side of caution. This means implementing the principle of “First, Do No Harm”. Experimental interventions should not be made that do not have robust evidence of safety as well as efficacy.

…survive the digestive tract and bioaccumulate in the brain. Milk EVs have been measured/detected in the blood plasma post prandial (after feeding), and those that do not get absorbed have been shown to affect gene transcription in the intestinal tract.

If there is presence of commercially produced SARS-CoV-2 S-protein-coding vaccine modified-mRNA in human breast milk, it is highly likely to survive the infant’s digestive tract, as human breast milk is enriched with EVs, and – as discussed above –

The modification of increasing the GC content in the vaccine-mRNA increases its heat stability, rendering our natural infection fighting process, such as running a fever to facilitate breaking down of viral mRNA, ineffective...

Viruses tend to have lower GC content than the host genome, making them sensitive to an increase in body temperature, which we get and aids in fighting an infection….

https://t.co/jEZ9GkduQE

The vaccine-mRNA has also been enriched with two of the main DNA base building blocks guanines (G) and cytosines (C), this modification further increases transcription production of the biologically active spike-protein.

https://t.co/4R7DmkZNV2

https://t.co/woQ3Q9YtDp

...but also make it to the brain via the vagus nerve and those not absorbed in the intestines remain there, biologically active.

https://t.co/07ClcKrfxB

This modification also increases the translation of the mRNA, resulting in the protein product being synthesized, i.e., the spike-protein actually being manufactured.

https://t.co/lJo8n9MRyz

https://t.co/gbPqdqXidb

To further increase stability of the vaccine-mRNA, a cap and tail modification was added.

7- ethylguanosine “cap” at the 5’ end of the vaccine mRNA and a poly-adenine (poly-A) tail added to the 3’ end, 100 or more adenine nucleotides

https://t.co/MMTlstq0FJ

...enzymes ability to recognise and access cleavage sites, that is part of the degradation process, stabilising the vaccine-mRNA against digestion, ensuring longer survival.

https://t.co/MMTlstq0FJ

One of the methods is the uridine nucleotides are not the type found in natural mRNA, they have been substituted with N-methyl-pseudo-uridines. 

This methylation was done to prevent the vaccine-mRNA from being easily broken down, altering digestion...

https://t.co/57ewCWIytG

A common mistake many people are making, is equating natural mRNA properties with the SARS-CoV-2 injection mRNA. The vaccine-mRNA has been modified to a form never before seen in nature, and manipulated to ensure stability and delay enzymatic digestion.
Obviously, because there are so many unknowns, this is exactly why fully completed wide ranging studies are required to be completed before subjecting humans to risk from unknown harms.

It is likely that the vaccine-mRNA will be found in EVs, however, we do not know if fragmented and/or EV-free parts could make it into the plasma and breast milk, potentially protected by complexing with proteins such as Ago2.

We have no idea if it will contribute to gut issues, it has already been shown that breastmilk EVs and miRNAs bioaccumulate in the brain, and those that do not, alter gene regulation in the gut.

https://t.co/mrHOAUUXNJ

Extracellular, EV encapsulated, or fragmented vaccine-mRNA, if not digested, will like be recognised as DAMPS (damage associated molecular patterns) by the innate immune system, and initiate inflammatory signalling cascades. 

This clearly would not be good for a nursing baby.

How do we know that fragmented versions of these non-natural enhanced mRNAs are not biologically active, much in the same way as miRNA and siRNA

https://t.co/0Og5vrWY0U

It is clear there is still so much unknown, which means there can be no assurances of safety.

This challenges the claim that the vaccine-mRNA is rapidly degraded. 

https://t.co/xfgdcCai30

Furthermore, RNA has been found in a highly stable vesicle-free form in the bloodstream, complexed with proteins such as Argonaute2 (Ago2) which protect them from digestion by RNase enzymes. 

https://t.co/buUkjttIRR

https://t.co/L54CzqSogX
https://t.co/jiQKt2kH0x
https://t.co/0Og5vrWY0U
https://t.co/f8YHj9KghS
https://t.co/0OLHCtaSiz
https://t.co/fgiRbVgG8A
https://t.co/D6j72kfQES
https://t.co/D6j72kfQES
https://t.co/NQk9jDBzjh

MicroRNAs and mRNA have been detected in human breast milk, and shown to survive passage through the stomach, protected from enzymatic digestion and acidic conditions, maintaining their biologically active capabilities.

https://t.co/0Og5vrWY0U
@I_mitochondria Benefit. Not risk

…and that human breast milk EVs are readily taken up into the vascular system and more specifically bioaccumulate in the brain.

Milk-derived exosomes and metabolic regulation
https://t.co/EcIsMqvvot

Milk exosomes: beyond dietary microRNAs
https://t.co/QbddrrA8ZL

The vaccine-mRNA is transported in lipid nanoparticles designed to mimic human extracellular vesicles (EVs). 

There is extensive research demonstrating that EVs in milk survive the human digestive tract…

https://t.co/RL0yFZDPmb

It is claimed:

Any vaccine-mRNA present in breastmilk, consumed by the infant, will be readily digested. 

However, this is an unproven claim, as it has not been tested and is something that should be investigated in animal studies before embarking on experimenting on babies.

200ng/100mL breast milk/feed.

Now multiply that by five feeds in a day, bringing it up to 1,000ng/feed 

1 microgram in a day. 

Assuming baby feeds at least 5 times per day (potentially more), this clearly increases the risk of breastmilk derived vaccine-mRNA exposure.

This investigation claimed the level of vaccine-mRNA detected in human breastmilk was very low, the highest concentration at 2ng/mL. 

A nursing infant may on average drink 100mL of breastmilk per feed, resulting in a baby potentially exposed to 200ng of vaccine-mRNA in one meal

A better study would have taken at minimum 2 samples everyday, one sample being foremilk and one being hindmilk, for at least 28 days post 1st and again post 2nd dose of experimental vaccination:

2 pre 1-fore/1-hindmilk
1 foremilk/1 hindmilk/day for 28days post 1st and 2nd dose
If the vaccine-mRNA is in the more fat-rich hindmilk, while the samples collected were from the foremilk this would have increased the likelihood of missed detection.

The authors do not indicate if they collected foremilk or hindmilk and we do not know which stage of milk would have more extracellular-vesicle (EVs) containing vaccine-mRNA, nor if there would be EV free vaccine-mRNA (mRNA not inside of a vesicle).

This number may likely be greater, given nursing infants often nurse more than five times a day and the only 4 samples of breast milk collected per participant, those samples were taken over several weeks.

Looking at the study data:

The 4+ve of the 40 samples, came from 3 participants out of the 10 

This means 30% of the mothers tested positive to having vaccine-mRNA in their breast milk. 

Put another way:

3 out of 10 babies are being exposed to experimental vaccine-mRNA.

We do not know if the samples represent the foremilk or hindmilk, which may impact results.

Authors detected vaccine-mRNA presence in 4/40 samples, giving the impression of a low rate of +ve detection, as 90% of samples were vaccine-mRNA free, implying presence was minimal/rare

n=10 lactating healthcare workers, nursing their infants 
4 breastmilk samples collected/participant

Sample taken:
1: pre 1st dose of Pfizer/BioNtech experimental vaccine,
2: 1-3 days post, 
3: 7-10 days post 1st dose,
4: 3-7 days post second dose of experimental mRNA vaccine.

Current claims regarding the safety of the vaccine-mRNA itself are not supported by robust evidence. 

In a recent preprint, Low et al. (2021) detected SARS-CoV-2-COVID19 (SARS2) vaccine-mRNA in human breast milk.

https://t.co/rgmBWd93az

It is being claimed that: 
 
1.Human breast milk does not contain SARS-CoV-2 vaccine-mRNA; and  

2.That if there were any vaccine-mRNA in breast milk, it would not survive the nursing infant’s digestive tract. 

https://t.co/oKQqF81SoH
